Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie406
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed after flying from Australia. It was clean and comfortable, easy to come and go as we pleased. There was just one shared bathroom, but it wasn't too busy so we didn't have any problems with that. We didn't find it too noisy, but that might be due to the season (we were there in May). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice manager, but...”
Reviews.Author: DMax82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Both times I had the cheapest single room at the front of the building, facing the street. The manager is a nice guy, but he is rarely around. On my second stay nobody was there when I arrived, and I had to wait around a while. Once you get settled it's a great place though. Location is excellent - very close to shopping, sights, and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dbth2
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean. Great location but unfortunately very noisy. Suggest considering purely to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Ratings”
Reviews.Author: pppbjisisko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at a small double room facing the street (facing the noisy Santa Ana direction). Our bed is small for a couple. And we did get annoyed by the noises in the late night. So which room and rate one will get did contribute to the non-uniform ratings people posted here. I feel the hostal may be understaffed and our room did not get cleaned up even once during the three nights we stayed. Hostal Horizonte is decorated with a lot of antiques and collections the owner collected from his travel but the lighting is so low that I don't think many guests would be enticed to appreciate them. Rent is cheap, so I do not complaint. Location is great (for Sol, three museums, airport and train), except if one will be coming from/going to the bus station direction. Taxi will cost 15 euro or more. Then, it'd be better to find something to trade more values off by 15 euro for a stay in Madrid. It may be also a little too hot for the rooms facing the street during the summer. The shower is on the other side of the hostal so once you get sweaty, you have to think about whether to walk across the hall way just to get some moist.

Reviews.Title: “A greta quite hostal”
Reviews.Author: crassell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Alfonso XII room which had its own bathroom. It was a nice quaint room and was greta for our three nights in Madrid. The hostal is close to del sol and the metro. It had free wifi and the room was of average size. The owner was freindly and gave us a map with some recommendations of places to visit. We would recommend this hostal for your stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to crash but don't expect frills”
Reviews.Author: dantri
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and simple but adequate and clean. The building is a bit odd to be honest but very charming. Almost makes you feel as though you're wandering around a museum of sorts. The owner/manager while not overly outgoing was friendly and happy to accommodate requests and answer questions. Share bathrooms were very clean and the place was very quiet, hauntingly so at times. They also had free wi fi which was excellent. Oh, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “This vacation made me want to move to Spain even more...”
Reviews.Author: N0tmyrealname
Reviews.Content: When I made the reservation I knew my plane was to arrive late in the evening. Julio, the hotel owner, was so kind to wait for my arrival. So a better start of my vacation is not imaginable. The hotel has a very nice atmosphere because of the colors and the scent of incense; just as a vacation should be like: laid-back. The rooms also are decorated attractively. I had one of the smallest rooms, but it's good enough. From the hostal to the plaza mayor is a 5min. walk. And although it's situated in a busy street the hostal itself is relatively quiet. Julio is as nice as most Spanish people and can give you good advice when you want to see something specifically. Though it has only been six days, this vacation made me want to move to Spain even more...

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but”
Reviews.Author: skrnoz
Reviews.Content: I'm staying there now. It has 2 types of rooms - basic sleeps with shared bathrooms (very clean) and rooms with private bath. If you just need a place to crash, it´s fine. But you need to contact Julio by email because he is rarely around to answer the phone. I stayed there 2 days in mid March and then Easter weekend. He tends to be around in late afternoon only. So you must give him a definite arrival time by email. If you just show up he is unlikely to be there. Also the cancellation policy is tough. He requires a credit card for the bookings and will charge a day´s rate if you cancel in less than 7 days. I got stuck because of the cancellation policy. I tried to check out after 2 nights and was told that I would be charged a penalty of one night rate for "cancellation." I knew of this policy but thought it applied to cancelling a booking before it started. So my advice is to use this hotel for short stays or as a back-up when availability is tight.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Clean, but Also Can be Noisy”
Reviews.Author: RTWtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hostel is in a great location in Madrid and you can expect to find clean rooms and bathrooms. The one drawback is that the doors are loud and the sound can easily keep you up at night. Also, we were a little annoyed to find that the night staff keeps their radio/TV on loud at night - so much so that we couldn't get away from the noise, even if we closed the window. This is a decent place if you are a heavy sleeper and are traveling cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Todd83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hostal Horizonte for 6 nights recently. Julio, the manager, couldn´t have been more friendly. Tastefully decorated rooms within 100m of Madrid´s best tapas bars and clubs. Only drawback was a very short bed, but I am 6´2¨, so if you´re under that height you should be fine. Anton Martin metro station on the same street. Bargain value!
